meanings.definition: To sprinkle or cover with small grains or particles
meanings.sent1: She peppered the salad with cheese.
meanings.sent2: The chef peppered the dish with herbs.
meanings.sent3: The kids peppered the playground with colorful chalk drawings.
meanings.sent4: The stars peppered the night sky like tiny diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The artist peppered the canvas with vibrant splashes of paint.

meanings.definition: To be scattered or distributed throughout
meanings.sent1: The seeds peppered the garden after the wind blew them away.
meanings.sent2: The confetti peppered the parade route.
meanings.sent3: The giggles of the children peppered the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The cheers of the crowd peppered the stadium during the game.
meanings.sent5: The colorful leaves peppered the ground in the autumn forest.

meanings.definition: To add a pungent or spicy flavor to food
meanings.sent1: She peppered the soup with a hint of chili.
meanings.sent2: The chef peppered the steak with black pepper.
meanings.sent3: The hot sauce peppered the dish with a fiery kick.
meanings.sent4: The jalapenos peppered the nachos with a spicy zing.
meanings.sent5: The curry powder peppered the rice with exotic flavors.
